doc.name: tokenOffset
doc.summary: Returns the number of tokens between the beginning of a value and an occurrence of a specified string.

example.p: tokenOffset("it's", "Tomorrow it's going to rain") -- returns 2

description.overview: Use the tokenOffset function to find which sentence a string occurs in.

parameter.name: stringToFind
parameter.description: The stringToFind is a string or an expression that evaluates to a string.

parameter.name: stringToSearch
parameter.description: The stringToSearch is a string or an expression that evaluates to a string.

parameter.name: tokensToSkip
parameter.description: The tokensToSkip is a non-negative integer. If you don't specify how many tokensToSkip, the tokenOffset function does not skip any tokens.

description.value: The tokenOffset function returns a non-negative integer.

comments.p: The value returned by the tokenOffset function is the number of the token where the stringToFind appears in stringToSearch. If the stringToFind is not in stringToSearch, the tokenOffset function returns zero. If the stringToFind is more than one token, the tokenOffset function always returns zero, even if the stringToFind appears in the stringToSearch.

If you specify how many tokensToSkip, the tokenOffset function skips the specified number of sentences in the stringToSearch. The value returned is relative to this starting point instead of the beginning of the stringToSearch.
